properties.name: Aasivissuit – Nipisat. Inuit Hunting Ground between Ice and Sea
properties.description: Located inside the Arctic Circle, this cultural landscape showcases the hunting grounds of the Inuit culture.

properties.name: Struve Geodetic Arc
properties.description: Chain of survey triangulations stretching from Hammerfest in Norway to the Black Sea.

properties.name: Laponian Area
properties.description: One of the last and largest remaining continuous reindeer grazing areas in the world.

properties.name: Ilulissat Icefjord
properties.description: Located on the west coast of Greenland, it is the sea mouth of Sermeq Kujalleq, one of the fastest and most active glaciers in the world.

properties.name: Rock Art of Alta
properties.description: This group of petroglyphs in the Alta Fjord represents a unique testimony to the settlements in the far north of Europe.

properties.name: Natural System of Wrangel Island Reserve
properties.description: This island has the highest level of biodiversity in the high Arctic.

properties.name: Putorana Plateau
properties.description: This plateau is a complete set of subarctic and arctic ecosystems in an isolated mountain range.

properties.name: Angkor
properties.description: Angkor is one of the most important archaeological sites in South-East Asia.

properties.name: Temple of Preah Vihear
properties.description: Situated on the edge of a plateau that dominates the plain of Cambodia, this temple is dedicated to Shiva.

properties.name: Temple Zone of Sambor Prei Kuk
properties.description: Archaeological site of Ancient Ishanapura, representing the cultural, social and political capital of the Chenla Empire.

properties.name: Koh Ker: Archaeological Site of Ancient Lingapura
properties.description: Archaeological site of the temporary capital of the Khmer Empire.

properties.name: Dja Faunal Reserve
properties.description: One of Africa's most species-rich rainforests, protected from human activity by the Dja River.

properties.name: L'Anse aux Meadows National Historic Site
properties.description: The remains of an 11th-century Viking settlement, the first European presence in North America.

properties.name: Nahanni National Park
properties.description: The park features exceptional natural beauty, including the South Nahanni River and Virginia Falls.

properties.name: Lakes of Ounianga
properties.description: A series of lakes in the heart of the Sahara desert, remnants of a much larger lake that existed during the wetter period.

properties.name: Rapa Nui National Park
properties.description: Easter Island's famous monumental statues (moai) created by the Rapa Nui people.

properties.name: Churches of Chiloé
properties.description: Outstanding examples of wooden ecclesiastical architecture, representing a unique fusion of European and indigenous cultural traditions.

properties.name: Port, Fortresses and Group of Monuments, Cartagena
properties.description: Cartagena's colonial walled city and fortress system are among the most complete and best preserved in South America.

properties.name: Los Katíos National Park
properties.description: Contains exceptional biodiversity and is home to many threatened animal species, as well as many endemic plants.

properties.name: Cocos Island National Park
properties.description: The waters around this island are home to large populations of hammerhead sharks, rays, dolphins and other large marine species.

properties.name: Area de Conservación Guanacaste
properties.description: This site demonstrates significant natural habitats for in-situ conservation of biological diversity.

properties.name: Historical Complex of Split with the Palace of Diocletian
properties.description: The ruins of Diocletian's Palace, built between the late 3rd and early 4th centuries A.D., can be found throughout the city.

properties.name: Old City of Dubrovnik
properties.description: The 'Pearl of the Adriatic', situated on the Dalmatian coast, became an important Mediterranean sea power from the 13th century onwards.

properties.name: Plitvice Lakes National Park
properties.description: The waters flowing over the limestone and chalk have, over thousands of years, deposited travertine barriers, creating natural dams.

properties.name: Old Havana and its Fortification System
properties.description: The historic centre of Cuba's capital, founded in 1519, contains the core of the original city and its fortification system.

properties.name: Trinidad and the Valley de los Ingenios
properties.description: Founded in the early 16th century, Trinidad was a prosperous center for sugar trade in the 18th and 19th centuries.

properties.name: Paphos
properties.description: The remains of ancient villas, palaces, theatres, fortresses and tombs make the site an outdoor museum of Byzantine art.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Prague
properties.description: Built between the 11th and 18th centuries, the Old Town, Lesser Town and New Town speak of the great architectural and cultural influence Prague had in medieval Europe.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Český Krumlov
properties.description: This medieval town has preserved its architectural heritage intact thanks to its peaceful evolution over more than five centuries.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Telč
properties.description: The town's Gothic castle was reconstructed in High Gothic style in the late 15th century.
